body.p: To open the XML Format preferences page, go to Options Window Preferences oXygen XML Editor Author Editor Format XML .

dlentry.dd: TheFormat and Indent operation preserves all empty lines found in the document;
TheFormat and Indent operation preserves text content as it is, without removing or adding any white space.
Line breaks found in attribute values are preserved;When this option is enabled, Break long lines option is automatically disabled.
TheFormat and Indent operation breaks long attribute values;

Theinline elements are indented on separate lines if they are preceded by white spaces and they follow another element start or end tag. Example:
Original XML: <root> text <parent> <child></child> </parent> </root>
Indent inline elements enabled:<root> text <parent> <child/> </parent> </root>
Indent inline elements disabled:<root> text <parent> <child/> </parent> </root>
TheFormat and Indent operation outputs empty elements with a separate closing tag, ex. . When not enabled, the same operation represents an empty element in a more compact form: ;
TheFormat and Indent operation sorts the attributes of an element alphabetically;

dt.uicontrol: Add space before slash in empty elements

dlentry.dd: Inserts a space character before the trailing / and > of empty elements;
TheFormat and Indent operation breaks the line before the attribute name;

dt.uicontrol: Indent (when typing) in preserve space elements

dlentry.dd: ThePreserve space elements (identified by the xml:space attribute set to preserve or by their presence in the Preserve space elements list) are normally ignored by the Format and Indent operation. When this option is enabled and you are editing one of these elements, its content is formatted.

dt.uicontrol: Indent on paste - sections with number of lines less than 300

dlentry.dd: When you paste a chunk of text that has less than 300 lines, the inserted content is indented. To keep the indent style of the document you are copying content from, disable this option.
